instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01987: What is 820-01987? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR: What is PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR? This is the input that comes from the charger..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG? This is battery power that flows to the system AFTER it has gone through a current sense resistor, before it goes through a fuse to become PPBUS_G3H power rail. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.U6903: What is U6903? This chip is responsible for creating PP3V3_G3H in 2016-2018 model Macbook logic boards.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: this board in f7000 oscillates voltage between 3 and 0v, also  <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_CHGR</SIGNAL> oscillates voltage 3 and 0v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
What about USB-C meter?

Remove F7000 and check if voltage behavior changes?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message: when removing f7000 <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CHGR_REG</SIGNAL>=12.28,UBC-C meter it does not work when is f7000 conected, when removing f7000, usc-meter if it works,5v,0A; mode diode <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>=0.429

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all big coils.
Don't forget L6900 and L9080.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01987</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turn on
threads.message:
Pretty short on the <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL> power rail.
Remove <RESISTOR>R6934</RESISTOR>/35 and check where the (very) low value remains.
You may need to use voltage injection to find the culprit.

BTW, when you have more coils tied together, one is sufficient to check.
